column7:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)*

CAPITALISM SHOULD BE ON SOCIETY'S TERMS

Many in society have been taught to believe that the public has no right to tell corporations what to do with their money any more than a private citizen has the right to tell his neighbor what to do with the money he earns from a business or store. This is not a fair analogy.

True enough that a private citizen doesn’t have the right to tell his neighbor what to do with his money but the public does have the right to tell corporations what to do with their money. Why? Because corporations couldn’t exist without very special and unique government help. Corporations are special legal entities that have unique rights::: privileges::: and protections given by government that ordinary citizens and business owners do not have. And::: since the government in a democracy like ours comes from the people (the majority in society) and it's the people's government that gave corporations their unique rights and privileges::: the people have the right to determine how corporations act and how they spend their money. The majority in a democracy own the franchise of government!

Therefore::: the public has a right to demand something from corporations in exchange for giving corporations the right to exist. Would I not have the right::: even as a private citizen::: to demand something from a business built on my property? The same logic applies to the relationship between the public (society) and corporations. Corporations cannot hide behind the specious argument of rugged individualism!

Many in our society have been brainwashed to believe that an absolutely free marketplace with no government controls or regulations would automatically fix our nation’s problems. Have we forgotten already that the Great Depression of the early 1930s was the direct result of a free market economy with no government control or regulation? The 2008 market crash was because of lack of enough government regulation in capitalism::: and if government hadn't intervened to rescue the banks capitalism would have ended in our country and we would have all starved to death. That's right!

Rugged individualism teaches that the individual has the right to benefit from social and economic interactions with society::: but that society has no right to demand any benefit from the individual.

No one has absolute individual rights in society. Those who want absolute individual rights must live outside of society. Those who want to be part of society with the benefits of government and law must be willing to grant what the majority want::: even if it’s at their own expense.

Yes::: minorities have rights::: but the majority has more rights. Absolute individualism is absolutely unfair. The majority has the right to tax an individual and collect money to build a park even if that individual doesn’t want the park and will never use the park. The majority has a right to tax an individual and use the money to provide welfare or help to those who genuinely can’t help themselves in society.

Self-proclaimed
rugged individualists in society want all the benefits of what the majority has to provide - government::: law::: security::: and protection - but they do not want give up anything to the majority in exchange for these benefits. These so-called rugged individualists are the real leeches and parasites of society.

The fact is there are no real rugged individualists in society!

If capitalism and social consciousness cannot coexist::: then how is it that modern industrialized nations such as Canada::: Sweden::: Norway::: Denmark::: and others can have a high degree of social consciousness and still be capitalistic with a thriving free enterprise?

The rich are not paying their fair share of the taxes. Even billionaire Warren Buffet has said that his office secretary pays more in taxes in proportion to her income than he does.

The wealthy and corporations in our country have socked away trillions of dollars (yes::: trillions of dollars) overseas so that their money cannot be taxed. If our government could tax that money::: at a fair and reasonable rate::: we would have enough money in this country to pay for all public services without having to tax the middle class more. We could do a lot for our nation and people.

Strategic taxes on corporations alone would provide plenty of money to provide a safety net for Americans. These corporations won't go broke but can still thrive and grow. They do it in Sweden::: Denmark::: Norway::: Germany::: Canada. They can do it here in the U.S.A.!

The far right wants no controls and regulations on the economy::: and that's what got us in the economic mess in 2008. Without legitimate controls and regulations in the financial markets::: the greedy in our financial world were able to amass huge fortunes through dishonesty and would have totally destroyed all our lives if not for government intervention into the banking and economic system.

Corporations receive special legal status and tax benefits from the government::: which private business owners do not have::: and the government comes from the people (society). So::: corporations do have a duty to the general society and not just to their shareholders. Government should tax corporations to help society as modern and advanced European nations do (i.e. Sweden::: Norway::: Germany).

People can still become wealthy in a socialist society but not at the detrimental expense of others in society. Many of the basic rights::: especially regarding safety in the work place::: that we take for granted were not graciously given to society by the rich but won by the blood of bludgeoned workers and strikers in the early 20th century.

The NCAA::: which governs the eligibility of college athletes::: decided this summer to ease its ban on student endorsements and other commercial ties. Many in college athletics agreed that the rules::: developed after World War II::: were in need of updating. For most student-athletes at Harvard and other universities::: the changes offer new flexibility.

Rugby player Kiani Akina::: co-captain of the squash team Sam Scherl::: and cross country team member Acer Iverson shared their thoughts: https://hrvd.me/NIL21f

- Unvaccinated people
- Immunocompromised people

- Getting vaccinated

column56:
The FDA has a multitude of recalls past and present that were at one time approved. Not only approved for use but some were injected or implanted and recalled after so many people suffered injury. I trusted my Dr when I was implanted with a medical device. It was later recalled for causing cancer of the immune system. Was I misinformed? No::: I was told it was safe. My Dr's assured me it was safe. It wasn't safe but the Dr's go by what the FDA says like when they said opiates were safe until people started dropping like flies and who went to jail? The Dr's who prescribed them. What about the steroid injection I had put in my shoulder that a month later the FDA recalled for contamination? Recalls are public information and my point is that FDA approves stuff then they recall those same approvals. Which one will it be? If the testing was so rigorous then how was a medical device approved on 2006::: adverse reports pilling in 2011::: Dr's notified in 2016 and the public didn't know until an official recall notice in 2020. So in one year they can tell somethings safe? What type of sorcery is that? Are you trying to say in one year the FDA can prove safety? If thats the case then they are liable to alot of people for allowing unsafe (recalled) medical devices and medications to remain on the market so long before recalling. In fact those unsafe products would never have made it to market if safety was truly revealed in just one year. Im not trying to influence anyone but don't assume people are so malleable to depend on social media to make medical choices. Sometimes I wonder if Harvard is selling tickets to the show. If you think people are misinformed then inform them and equip them with the whole truth and nothing but the truth. The FDA makes mistakes and alot of them. If thats not the truth then there is corruption inside the FDA and someones selling approval stamps on alot of stuff! Which one is the truth or are they both truths? The problem isn't misinformation.
The problem is a lack of trust. Opiates are safe enough to make billions but people died so there you go::: who would trust the FDA after that fiasco.

column110:
WHY ARE YOU NOT TALKING ABOUT ESSENTIAL OILS? -\-\Essential oils (EOs) are comprised of a complex mixture of volatile phytochemicals from diverse classes including monoterpenes::: sesquiterpenes:::
and phenylpropanoid
s. Numerous researchers have studied the antibacterial::: antifungal::: antioxidant::: and antiviral properties of EOs. These EOs are found to be active against a wide variety of viruses::: such as influenza virus (IFV)::: human herpesviruses (HSV)::: human immunodeficienc
y virus (HIV)::: yellow fever virus::: and avian influenza (Ma and Yao 2020). HSV (-1 and -2) are known to cause many life-threatenin
g diseases in humans and are one of the major reasons for mortality in immunocompromis
ed patients. HSV-1 is majorly responsible for HSV-induced lesions in the oral cavity and epidermis::: while HSV-2 causes genital herpes::: a sexually transmitted disease. An in vitro study conducted by Schnitzler and colleagues showed that lemon balm oil inhibited plague formation of HSV-1 and HSV-2 viruses in a dose-dependent fashion. Moreover::: at higher concentrations it abolished the viral infectivity almost completely (Schnitzler et al. 2008). Pre-treatment with EOs obtained from illicium verum::: Melaleuca alternifolia::: Leptospermum scoparium::: and Matricaria recutita was found to inhibit the infective ability of acyclovir-sensi
tive and -resistant HSV stains::: indicating the immense antiviral potential of EOs (Schnitzler et al. 2010). Anti-IFV properties of liquid and vapour forms of EOs obtained from various plant species were studied using in vitro techniques. Vapours of EOs obtained from Citrus bergamia::: Eucalyptus globulus::: and their isolated compounds::: i.e. citronellol and eugenol showed rapid anti-IFV actions. While in liquid form::: EOs obtained from Cinnamomum zeylanicum::: Citrus bergamia::: Cymbopogon flexuosus::: and Thymus vulgaris showed better anti-IFV properties i.e. 100% inhibitory activity at 3.1 µL/mL as compared with others. Vapour form of EOs was also found to be safe against monolayers of epithelial cells. The study concluded that EOs in vapour form could benefit people suffering from influenza (Vimalanathan and Hudson 2014). Carvacrol and its isomer thymol obtained from oregano have been shown to inhibit viral host cell fusion via depletion of viral cholesterol from the HIV-1 envelope membranes::: thus blocking the entry of the virus into the host system (Mediouni et al. 2020).
Owing to the lipophilic nature of EOs::: these have the potential to intercalate into the lipid double layer of the viral envelope. Subsequently::: the fluidity of the membranes is changed and::: at a higher concentration::: the membranes are even ruptured (Wink 2020). Major mechanisms through which EOs induce antiviral actions are::: direct actions on free viruses::: inhibition of steps involved in virus attachment::: penetration::: intracellular replication::: and release from host cells and inhibition of vital viral enzymes (Ma and Yao 2020; Schnitzler et al. 2010). Keeping in view the diverse antiviral actions of EOs::: various claims were made by the EOs manufacturers/
suppliers as an effective therapy against COVID-19. In this regard::: research activities were conducted to check the anti-SARC-CoV-2
efficacies of EOs. The current review compiles available scientific information about the possible beneficial effects of EOs in COVID-19.
https://
www.ncbi.nlm.nih
.gov/pmc/
articles/

column16:
Most of us want to be happy. We want to be content::: live in ease::: enjoy the company of our friends and family::: and not be bogged down with the stresses and strains of daily living. This is why if you were to ask the average person why they want to get a good job::: they would probably reply::: ‘to earn enough to live comfortably’. If you questioned them further and asked why they want to live comfortably::: they would say – just like the rest of us – ‘because I want to be happy’. Happiness is an end::: not a means. It is the final destination::: not the journey. We all want to be happy::: and we seek ways to ensure that we achieve a happy state.

What makes people happy varies from one person to the next: some work away for years to add degrees and career credentials to their names; some work night and day to achieve that perfect figure; some want the comforting love of a spouse or bustle of a family; some go wild with friends every weekend after a tough week at work; some devour lifestyle magazines to get a home looking up to standard; the list is endless. Whether it’s through money::: status::: other people or just a good time – everybody is involved in trying to ‘get happy’::: live happy::: and eventually just BE happy. Which begs the question::: what is true happiness? If it exists::: where does it lie and how do we get there?

To answer these questions consider the following. Imagine that while reading this you have been sedated against your will. Suddenly you wake up and find yourself on a plane. You are in first class. You have your own cabin. The food is heavenly. The seat is a flatbed::: designed for a luxurious comfortable experience. The entertainment is limitless. The service is out of this world. You start to enjoy all of the facilities. Think for a moment::: and ask yourself this question: am I happy?

How can you be… you need some questions answered first. How did you even get on the plane? Where is it headed to? If these questions remain unanswered::: how can you ever be happy? Even if you started to enjoy all of the luxuries at your disposal::: you would never achieve true happiness. Would that frothy Belgian chocolate mousse on your dessert tray be enough to drown out the questions? It would be a delusion::: a fake type of happiness::: only achievable by deliberately ignoring and suspending these critical questions.

Apply this to your life. Now ask yourself::: am I happy?

Our coming into existence is no different to being sedated and thrown on a plane. We never chose our birth. Yet some of us do not ask the questions or search for the answers that will help us achieve our ultimate goal: happiness.

column6:
This is atrocious. 2U pricing for content is completely inaccessible to the vast majority of EdX users::: meaning a platform designed to increase educational access and affordability will literally now work to exacerbate existing inequalities (by allowing well paid knowledge workers or cost agnostic students to further increase the distance between themselves and others). The fact that the proceeds of the sale will support nebulous other social ends is of little consolation.

My prediction is many content partners will pull out or cease collaboration akin to what has happened with Coursera. We will go back to a patchwork of online certificates and degrees (with substantially higher costs due to a lack of economies of scale and premium pricing for premium schools… see Cornell Online and Columbia Video Network for both points).

Meanwhile::: 2U’s fledgling rival Get Smarter already shows how a private aggregator in higher ed digital content works in action. Aggressively priced content from the few schools that can command high prices…

column7:
What if objects move in multiple speeds on an orbit? That means one object can change its speed while staying on the original orbit aka without any orbit change. I must say this is a more advanced orbit and more difficult to maneuver. Some concepts to share:
-Orbit Strechness：to measure the speed change within “one” orbit. For example: a car is moving on a straight line::: it may slow down the speed to avoid obstacles::: speeds change while the car is still staying on the same orbit. The same happens to space travel. A designed orbit in space may also slow down somewhere in between::: we can call that orbit strechness.
-Orbit Change/Orbit Shift: to observe one object moving from one orbit to another::: we can say leap::: we can also say orbit change/orbit shift.
Why the concept of orbit is so much important? According to our massive observations in space::: we can say that the universe is built upon orbits::: not forces. The forces we have measured are merely part of the enablers or intermediate factors.

and "crime". Louis Gohmert said the "FBI" is causing crimes.

Someone hands someone cash to do something::: the person receiving it is likely to understand (historically) that the cash is not traceable back to the person::: not if the person denies it and is not suspected of anything.

to-crypto-walle
t" transactions. ges that work in possibly unmanaged ways. Louis Gohmert: US government is causing crimes::: making them easier::: and there are people who commit crimes whose neurological state truly is that they have no empathy or limited empathy for other people -\-\ it's not a majority of people::: but maybe some people are like that and people sometimes find places where they have advantages that should not be easily allowed to exist if there's no good reason for them to exist. Let’s look at the concept of infinity again( some thoughts).
Let’s say::: one point on earth moving in a circle::: using the sun as the frame of reference::: the number of orbit changes will be infinite when it moves one circle::: the orbit at this finish line is straight forward at the finish point or the beginning point on the circle. If we just take the beginning point on the circle as the second comparable point::: it also moves by the earth orbit::: if we watch over these two points and control the speeds of these two points to let them be at the same point with the same speed ( sun as reference) when the circle point finished one circle::: then we have something going on here.
The orbit changes of the circle point are the infinitive orbit changes along the circle And the orbit changes along the earth orbit::: while::: the “still” point has only the infinitive orbit changes along the earth orbit which is included in the circle point orbit changes. Thus we have two infinities here. One is the circle shape orbit changes the other is the earth orbit changes. Another thing needs to be noticed is that since we control and watch over the speeds of these two points so that when the circle point finishes one circle::: it will have the same speed as of the still point::: or simply the circle point stops when one circle is finished according to earth perspective. Then the two points will be “dropped” at the exact same orbit when the circle point finishes one circle orbit changes.
My point is that these two infinitives can surely not be ignored to be one infinitive. So next time when we calculate anything related to infinitive::: remember the story of these two points. I am not quite sure about what contents are exactly included in this assumption::: but for sure it exists and for real and not that eligible for being counted as nothing.
I am right::: aren’t I?

column9:
The universe is built upon orbits.

Orbits to this universe is like fixtures to buildings. Orbits are also somewhat like trees in that they are largely built and designed by the universe itself.
The point I am trying to express is that the universe is not built upon force::: the things we used to relate to force should be directly related to orbits. Gravity is about orbits::: horsepower is about orbits::: even emotion is about orbits.
The universe is born with orbits::: which can be very complex orbits existing together.

A few necessary terminologies and concepts:
UOC: unchanged orbit constant. UOC is not definitely ineligible for change::: just not to be changed at the moment or any timeline in sight; eg: gravity::: gravitational acceleration
TOC: total orbit constant(s): the overall orbit distribution and condition of the orbits in this vast universe
There is no such concept as mass (m)::: it is UOC::: the substance amount of one object is meaningless and also unmeasurable.
electricity light: the existence of all forms of the electricity::: light::: lightning::: radio and etc. Electricity light does not have to have brightness::: it is just one type of existence::: which is very very widely existing in this universe::: it is common existence it is also very advanced existence::: as well as that it is extremely useful and deep/complex/
even somewhat mysterious in its functions. The mystery of electricity light is comparable to that of a living organic. It is the fact and truth just like the birth of this universe::: the constitution of a human body::: the living and growing of a tree. The basic function of electricity light is carrying messages or information.
orbit key: the stuff that is used to change orbit(s)::: for example: the horsepower to accelerate a car::: the friction to stop a car.

Now let’s turn to the classic laws about force.
Newton I: inertia. It is simply about one object that is on an or various orbit(s) without any instant change.
Newton II: m=G/g::: so it is something=a/g * G(gravity)::: the something here is an existence form of the orbit(s) change::: we can call it the orbit keys::: which is more like a bridge thing not any destination or full stop of any assumptions or theories. Thus the point here is about that the orbit keys here equals to the gravity of the object times the ratio of acceleration and one earth orbit constant (let’s say UOC here::: unchanged orbit constant). And as we all know gravity is measured by spring(s) or things like that.
Newton III: the contact of two surfaces and orbits changes in different directions::: which is not necessarily reversed.
universal gravitation: no need to have this concept or does not exist.
inertial force: multiple orbits change situations aka no such force::: it is merely the change of the related orbits of the objects due to the orbit keys.

The Extremely or Very important assumption:
The universe is not designed for destruction::: it is designed for life and living::: so all of our believes must go to the positive healthy direction/
side::: that is to say: we must believe that the universe is fundamentally healthy::: gorgeous::: unbreakable::: well-run. Proof: we know so little about our universe::: we haven’t even get out of our galaxy::: we are alive till this day::: we prosper and are having fun here::: feeling safe and happy.
This assumption started from the birth of this universe with all of its supporting (fixture) orbits and will not end.

Peter LeHane Irving. I was named after him::: my cousin once removed was named after him::: and one of my friends whose grandparents were friends with mine was as well. A truly remarkable man that touched every single person who he helped. He was the first general surgeon at Barton Memorial Hospital.

column28:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)*

OUR LIVING WORLD: NOT INVENTED BY NATURE

JUST BECAUSE something exists in nature does not mean it was invented by nature. If all the chemicals (i.e. amino acids::: nucleic acids::: etc.) necessary to make a cell were left to themselves::: “Mother Nature” would have no ability to organize them into a cell. It requires an already existing cell to bring about another cell. The cell exists and reproduces in nature but nature didn’t invent or design it! Nature didn’t originate the cell or any form of life. An intelligent power outside of nature had to be responsible.

Miller::: in his famous experiment in 1953::: showed that amino acids (the building blocks of life) could form by chance. But::: it’s not enough just to have amino acids. The various amino acids that make-up life must link together in a precise sequence::: just like the letters in a sentence::: to form functioning protein molecules. It has never been shown that various amino acids can bind together into a sequence by chance to form protein molecules.

Natural laws may explain how an airplane or cell works::: but it’s not rational to believe that undirected natural laws can bring about an airplane or a cell.

ONCE YOU HAVE a complete and living cell then the genetic program (or code) and biological machinery exist to direct the formation of more cells::: but how could the cell have originated naturally when no directing code and mechanisms existed in nature?

Mathematicians have said any event in the universe with odds of 10 to 50th power or greater is impossible! The probability of just an average size protein molecule arising by chance is 10 to the 65th power. Even the simplest cell is made up of many millions of various protein molecules along with and DNA/RNA..

The late great British scientist Sir Frederick Hoyle calculated that the odds of even the simplest cell coming into existence by chance is 10 to the 40:::000th power! How large is this? Consider that the total number of atoms in our universe is 10 to the 82nd power.

The cell didn't evolve. A partially evolved cell would quickly disintegrate::: not wait millions of years to become complete and living.

WHAT ABOUT EVOLUTION? Only evolution within “kinds” is genetically possible (i.e. varieties of dogs::: cats::: horses::: cows::: etc.)::: but not evolution across “kinds” (i.e. from sea sponge to human). How could species have survived if their vital tissues::: organs::: reproductive systems were still evolving? Survival of the fittest would actually have prevented such evolution! Only limited evolution::: variations of already existing genes and traits::: is possible. Nature is mindless and has no ability to design and program entirely new genes for entirely new traits.

WHAT ABOUT NEW SPECIES: Although new species have come into existence::: they don't carry any new genes. They've become new species only because they can't be crossed back with the original parent stock for various biological reasons. A biological "kind" allows for new species but not new genes. Nature has no ability to invent new genes for new traits. Only limited variations and adaptations are possible in nature::: and all strictly within a biological "kind" (i.e. varieties of dogs::: cats::: etc.).

All species of plants and animals in the fossil record are found complete::: fully formed::: and fully functional. This is powerful evidence that all species came into existence as complete and fully formed from the beginning. This is only possible by creation.

What about natural selection? Natural selection doesn't produce biological traits or variations. It can only "select" from biological variations that are possible and which have survival value. That’s why it’s called natural “selection.” The real issue is what biological variations are possible::: not natural selection. Only variations and mutations of already existing genes or traits are possible.

Dr. Randy J. Guliuzza’s extensive research points to a better explanation than natural selection for variation and adaptation in nature. Dr. Guliuzza explains that species have pre-engineered mechanisms that enable organisms to continuously track and respond to environmental changes with system elements that correspond to human-designed tracking systems. This model is called CET (continuous environmental tracking). His research strongly indicates that living things have been pre-engineered to produce the right adaptations and changes required to live in changing environments. It’s much like a car that’s been pre-engineered so that the head lights turn on automatically when day changes to night.

Modern evolutionists believe and hope that over::: supposedly::: millions of years::: random mutations in the genetic code caused by environmental radiation will generate entirely new genes for natural selection to use. This is total blind and irrational faith on the part of evolutionists. It’s much like believing that randomly changing the sequence of letters in a romance novel::: over millions of years::: will turn it into a book on astronomy! That’s the kind of blind faith macro-evolution
ists have.

Mutations are accidents in the genetic::: are mostly harmful::: and have no capability of producing greater complexity in the code. Even if a good accident occurred::: for every good one there would be hundreds of harmful ones with the net result::: over time::: being harmful::: even lethal::: to the species. Even if a single mutation is not immediately harmful::: the accumulation of mutations over time will be harmful. At best::: mutations only produce further variations within a natural species. Most biological variations are not due to mutations but from new combinations of already existing genes.

What about genetic and biological similarities between species? Genetic information::: like other forms of information::: cannot happen by chance::: so it is more logical to believe that genetic and biological similarities between all forms of life are due to a common Designer who designed similar functions for similar purposes. It doesn't mean all forms of life are biologically related! Only genetic similarities within a natural species proves relationship because it's only within a natural species that members can interbreed and reproduce.

The actual similarity between ape and human DNA is between 70-87% not 99.8% as commonly believed. The original research stating 99.8% similarity was based on ignoring contradicting evidence. Only a certain segment of DNA between apes and humans was compared::: not the entire DNA genome.

All the fossils that have been used to support human evolution have been found to be either hoaxes::: non-human::: or human::: but not non-human and human (i.e. Neanderthal Man was discovered later to be fully human).

There has never been unanimous agreement among evolutionary scientists on ANY fossil evidence that has been used to support human evolution over the Many years::: Including LUCY.

Also::: so-called "Junk DNA" isn't junk. Although these "non-coding" segments of DNA don't code for proteins::: they have recently been found to be vital in regulating gene expression (i.e. when::: where::: and how genes are expressed::: so they're not "junk").

Read the author's Internet article::: NO MEAT-EATING ANIMALS EXISTED IN THE BEGINNING

Visit my latest Internet site: THE SCIENCE SUPPORTING CREATION (This site answers many arguments::: both old and new::: that have been used by evolutionists to support their theory)

Author of popular Internet article::: TRADITIONAL DOCTRINE OF HELL EVOLVED FROM GREEK ROOTS

* I have had the privilege of being recognized in the 24th edition of Marquis "Who's Who In The East" for my writings on religion and science::: and I have given successful lectures (with question and answer time afterwards) defending creation from science before evolutionist science faculty and students at various colleges and universities.

column9:
In the newly renovated Houghton Library::: the building’s original details now pair with modern enhancements. Sleek::: lighted display cases line the walls of the freshly painted foyer::: letting visitors easily engage with collection items. Large overhead lamps glow above gleaming wooden tables in the reading room::: which boasts a new group study room to encourage collaborative work. An inviting plaza in front connects to wheelchair-acce
ssible paths at the building’s entrance::: and a new elevator::: restrooms::: and other features vastly improve the building’s physical accessibility.

The only missing piece is the library’s patrons and visitors — but when it is safe to reopen the building::: they’ll find it more welcoming and accessible than ever before.

February marked the completion of Houghton Library’s 16-month project to renovate the world-renowned primary-source research center and teaching laboratory. The renovation was led by Ann Beha Architects in partnership with the Faculty of Arts and Sciences’ Office of Physical Resources and Planning.

The lobby is pictured.
The lobby of the renovated library.
While it’s hard not to be able to immediately share the renovated library with visitors::: completing construction during the pandemic is still a milestone::: said Tom Hyry::: the Florence Fearrington Librarian of Houghton Library.

“The completion of the Houghton renovation represents a positive development during challenging times:::” Hyry said. “The pandemic and the movement for racial justice have reinforced the direction the library is moving; to become a more welcoming::: inclusive::: and accessible institution in our collections::: services::: and programs::: in addition to our building.”

Hyry said the pandemic provided an opportunity and imperative to enhance digital resources and virtual services::: and library staff are eager to build on that.

“We’re excited to combine what we’ve learned in providing remote services and programs with a more modern physical environment when the library building reopens:::” he said.

He added that he expects this combination “will lead to major improvements in our overall support for teaching::: research::: and community enrichment.”

column6:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)*

POSSIBLY MILLIONS OF TONS OF VOLCANIC EARTH SOIL REACHED MARS (Newsweek)

A Newsweek article of September 21::: 1998::: p.12 mentions the high possibility of Earth life on Mars because of millions of tons of Earth soil ejected into space from ancient volcanic explosions. "We think there's about 7 million tons of earth soil sitting on Mars"::: says USC scientist Kenneth Nealson. "You have to consider the possibility that if we find life on Mars::: it could have come from the Earth" [Weingarten::: T.::: Newsweek::: September 21::: 1998::: p.12]. This may also explain why life forms may exist on Venus::: again because they originated from Earth.

In the Earth's past there was powerful volcanic activity which could have easily spewed dirt and rocks containing microbes and life into outer space which not only could have eventually reached Mars but also ended up traveling in orbit through space that we now know as meteors::: comets::: and asteroids. This would mean life forms found in meteorites originated from Earth in the first place.

Secular scientists have a different explanation from creationist scientists on the volcanic eruptions of the Earth's past. Creation scientists believe::: as Genesis teaches::: that as the fountains of the deep were opened to release water for the world-wide flood the force of the eruptions could have indeed spewed great amounts of earth soil into space.

Life could not have evolved. A partially evolved cell would quickly disintegrate under the effects of random forces of the environment::: especially without the protection of a complete and fully functioning cell membrane. A partially evolved cell cannot wait millions of years for chance to make it complete and living! In fact::: it couldn't have even reached the partially evolved state.

Having the right conditions and raw material for life do not mean that life can originate or arise by chance. Stanley Miller::: in his famous experiment in 1953::: showed that individual amino acids (the building blocks of life) could come into existence by chance. But::: it's not enough just to have amino acids. The various amino acids that make-up life must link together in a precise sequence::: just like the letters in a sentence::: to form functioning protein molecules. If they're not in the right sequence the protein molecules won't work. It has never been shown that various amino acids can bind together into a sequence by chance to form protein molecules. Even the simplest cell is made up of many millions of various protein molecules.

The probability of just an average size protein molecule arising by chance is 10 to the 65th power. Mathematicians have said any event in the universe with odds of 10 to 50th power or greater is impossible! The late great British scientist Sir Frederick Hoyle calculated that the odds of even the simplest cell coming into existence by chance is 10 to the 40:::000th power! How large is this? Consider that the total number of atoms in our universe is 10 to the 82nd power.

Also::: what many don't realize is that Miller had a laboratory apparatus that shielded and protected the individual amino acids the moment they were formed::: otherwise the amino acids would have quickly disintegrated and been destroyed in the mix of random energy and forces involved in Miller's experiment.

Miller's experiment produced equally both left-handed and right-handed amino acids::: but all living things strictly require only left-handed amino acids. If a right-handed amino acid gets into the chain the protein won't work.

There is no innate chemical tendency for the various amino acids to bond with one another in a sequence. Any one amino acid can just as easily bond with any other. The only reason at all for why the various amino acids bond with one another in a precise sequence in the cells of our bodies is because they're directed to do so by an already existing sequence of molecules found in our genetic code.

Of course::: once you have a complete and living cell then the genetic code and biological machinery exist to direct the formation of more cells::: but how could life or the cell have naturally originated when no directing code and mechanisms existed in nature? Read my Internet article: HOW FORENSIC SCIENCE REFUTES ATHEISM.

Visit my newest Internet site: THE SCIENCE SUPPORTING CREATION

Author of popular Internet article::: TRADITIONAL DOCTRINE OF HELL EVOLVED FROM GREEK ROOTS

4 million years ago. Tropical delta plains Many groups of monkeys eat fish.
These monkeys reduce their feathers to avoid being entangled in the water to catch fish. Monkeys reduce hairs like elephants::: water buffalo species::: rhino species to reduce water infiltration into the body.
Monkey stands on 2 legs so that the hands can easily catch fish. Monkeys walk on 2 feet to reduce the area of skin exposed to water.
2 monkey hands are more skillful and sensitive because of the job of catching fish.
The monkey's brain is wiser because catching fish requires intelligence rather than muscle strength.
These groups of monkeys have gone extinct. There is only one species left::: called the Humans.

column3: Now you can learn to talk nerdy with your hands. (socially acceptable communication) Very thought provoking because science has a language issue not only with that::: but the public and as well as within the same field and with paradigm different concepts. (socially unacceptable communication) Field of math has concepts of logical equivalence::: such as zorn's lemma implies axiom of choice::: and axiom of choice implies zorn's lemma::: which applied to physics would say there are many equivalent forms of physics that look strangely different than the current models. (this often invokes angry responses from physicists who think the equations found are an inherit property of the universe::: and not just a mathematical tool that explains it in one of the infinite ways) A few physicists have proven equivalent forms now::: so the field isn't completely devoid of such a concept::: its just a lot of physicists likely have no clue why that research is brilliant and should be awarded. Because it falls outside the typical paradigm::: outside the language norm::: those physicist will likely not be properly awarded for their brilliant work. (this is the point where maybe only 1 in 100:::000 could understand what I just wrote) Well back to the world of Candide the optimist.

column4: It is necessary to break the vicious circle of insomnia and the impaired coping with work. When sleep is stolen on a daily basis::: the risk is that sooner or later the health will pay too high a price and productivity will suffer.
column5:
1) Study depended upon patient Self reporting. That is the definition of Bias. A better design could be developing Ai tech that is highly accurate at detecting when people enter deep sleep that is not intrusive. Like just sleep with cell phone nearby::: it will run an app to clock in and clock out automatically.
2) If someone has a medical problem::: or pain::: it could be much harder to sleep. You don't hear people say "ohh my joints really hurts but I got great sleep last night". If a preexisting condition existed at twice the rate for those that couldn't sleep::: it could be the preexisting conditions. (emotional distress::: pain pills::: etc..etc..)
3) Are there different kinds of dementia::: and is the diagnosis like depression? Depression is a symptom of a wide range of medical problems::: and it can cause from vitamin deficiency to being seasonal from lack of sunlight. Places like Harvard from poor methodology like in 1) made a symptom into a disease. Which is highly inappropriate and rather trashy. Dementia likely has an equally bad diagnostic decision tree. Had they used tech to get around patient self reporting::: and had raw data::: they could have had brain scans for a more detailed report on what kind of dementia.
column6:
Its a curious thing .
You could almost be forgiven for thinking that in order to retain memory and cognitive function as you get older ::: you would prefer peaceful and quiet surroundings::: in other words an almost boring environment::: so incredibly dull ::: that you could just take a nap :::like when ever and wherever .
This would suggest that in life you probably would not want to be particularly successful::: just averagely comfortable::: perhaps with a degree of moderate wealth.
It sort of sounds a bit like how Paul Volcker described his lower middle class upbringing: comfortable ::: but everyone had a few chores ::: like mowing the lawn and washing the dishes.
I would like to propose an experiment to test this theory ; students ought to be encouraged to snooze during classes and lectures ::: just to see if :
(a) they absorb knowledge subconsciously simply by hearing the lecture whilst sleeping ::: thus reducing the risk of ::: um ::: what was that disease called again ?
and :::
(b) sorry I dozed off ::: could you repeat the question please ?
(c) to see if I can remember my grans coleslaw recipe .

There is now a growing demand for online tutoring globally. This provides talented students at Harvard and other colleges opportunities to teach younger students around the world. There is a new site called tutorshares.com that enables college students to do just that. It's an open and free platform for students and tutors to directly connect. Tutors can set their own rate or volunteer if they wish. There are going to be lasting changes from Covid as mentioned in the article::: good and bad::: we will just need to create opportunities where we can.

column1:
Organic food is likely not safer::: better nutritionally::: or grown by a small::: local farm::: Robert Paarlberg argues in an excerpt from his new book.

NEWS.HARVARD.EDU
Author Robert Paarlberg argues against buying organic
column3: This excerpt is full of false premise and strawman arguments::: pretending to get inside the heads of people who support organic::: sustainable::: agro ecology::: etc. Completely false in that these forms of agriculture have been and still are::: extensively researched. False in claiming the discussion of health is only about human health::: when it's more holistic concerns about biodiversity and soil health (and the devastating impacts of overuse of all kinds of fertilizers to our waterways.) False in claiming there's only one form of organic certification::: or that's the only way to obtain organic products. Lastly::: organic systems are studied in terms of food supply and security. Leaving everything up to a couple of biotech giants to patent and control is dangerous and infringes upon our freedom and sovereignty. Farmers grow conventional not because of cost::: but because of risk. They would switch in a heartbeat to get higher prices::: if only we would share the risk by supporting them in case of crop failures (which does still happen to conventional farmers.) If anything::: this book is going to push more of us to create an even bigger demand for sustainably produced food products.
column4: Hmm. This article is largely about efficiency and cost in favor of Food::: Inc. There is no consideration of taste and well being. I’ve been fortunate enough to spend time these past several years in Tuscany. It’s true that anyone can feel like a great chef after cooking up almost anything from the local markets. It tastes so much better and comes seasonally in much greater variety. I chalk it up to an unswerving devotion by the populace that refuses to give it up.
column5:
SMH if you are going to write an article about organic farming::: you should actually have experience in doing it. I’ve been organically farming for my family for years and I can tell you there is in fact a big difference in taste and mineral content when done correctly. Theres also a huge difference in the taste of meat and eggs of animals who are well cared for and grass fed. Our eggs are bright orange and taste delicious because our chickens get plants from our untreated property and kitchen scraps in addition to their feed. While he has a point with some of the commercial farming practices::: there are inconsistencies
in manure management and soil replenishment. There is a better way. A follow up article that covers farming practices that does produce delicious food::: less contamination and smarter farming practices would be more valuable info to share.
column6: This must be written by someone who eats glyphosate latent foods and probably is stupid enough to own stock in such companies. Just goes to show that just because you went to Harvard or have a PHD doesn't make you smart. Rather::: it makes you conform to the System that created your thinking.
column7:
To be or not to be organic::: that is the question. The balance leans towards flavor::: color::: texture::: aroma::: pesticide-free:::
traceability::: etc. Organic farming is more expensive::: but it has undeniable benefits.The nutritional value is identical.
column8: This is not a strong argument and doesn't get the motives for buying or growing organic. I've been buying and sometimes growing organic food since the late 60's. -\-\Not strictly. Less harmful to self and planet. - better flavour.
column9: Perhaps the push should be for adjustments to what is included in organic certification. It is surely better for our environment to stop the use of synthetic herbicides and insecticides. That::: to me::: is the reason purchasing organic makes sense - it is ‘safer’ for the environment. In centering the motivations on humans only::: I think Paarlberg misses the mark. Really feels like a hit piece paid for by big ag.
column10: This article is vaguely exaggerated::: in favor of large scale conventional farmers and food inc.it’s so funny to see that organic farmers use more plastic compared to the conventional farmers::: on what basis? Many false claims has been made in order to green wash.Food need to be local::: Organic need to be the mainstream of future food.
column11: I think that the bio food is the best food::: bio organic is natural::: no poison .
column12:
“Consumers tend to favor organic food because they believe the advocates who claim it is safer and more nutritious to eat::: but there is little or no scientific evidence to support these claims.”

I disagree on the last clause of this statement. I kept reading the article looking for his specific examples of this contention::: but he did not connect the dots that he tried to align. Perhaps he intended to be more anecdotal::: but the price of that is an unconvincing article with a shocking subject line. I would be curious to see citations of studies proving that organic is not safer chemically speaking; I have read scientific studies on how crops soak up chemicals and retain them in systemic pesticide-spray
ed fields.
column13: He is writing from an American perspective. How does American grown Organic compare with British grown Organic? What guidelines exist and how do they differ? Yes::: if it is more Labour intensive I expect to pay more. Similarly::: if there was little difference in production I would be upset at being conned.
column14: In the past when ever I got forced into going to a farmers market by someone whom I might be dating::: I always felt that I was in a alternant reality because I would spend most of my time people watching rather than squeezing eggplants or sniffing onions. The customers and consumers always seem like people on a mission to another planet where truth and reality are tilted slightly in the direction of another Universe. On top of that I don't like to be jostled around by people with sacks who are in a mad dash for the perfect portobello mushroom! All 4 of my grandparents lived into their middle ninety's and if they had anything in common at all was the fact that they ate modest and balanced diets! Both my grandfathers never cooked a meal in their lives!
column15: Organic is a defined expression and growing that way forbid certain substances. It does not explicitly say what to use. Local does not say its less polluted. growing organically next to a highway::: required few inch above a brownfield::: a dirty plant::: close proximity to conventionally grown fields (wind). I have not heard that the FDA randomly controls.
column16:
Speaking only from personal experience::: I think maybe that growing your own peas and beans basil and parsley in a little polycarbonate green house::: with maybe a few comfrey plants to provide the raw liquid fertiliser ingredients::: is a reasonably decent value investment; you get some nice produce for the kitchen ::: for a small outlay . There are companion plant flowers which are supposed to repel pests and some bird life will chase caterpillars and so on ::: but the reality is most of our food requires tractors ::: artificial fertiliser and pesticides and herbicides.
But a bit of produce from both schools of thought will probably always be the method by which dinner arrives.
column17:
Hummm.... the law of supply and demand::: farm subsidies for “traditional” crops::: and the nonchalant take on the impact of pesticides in the environment and to humans? “Pillage and plunder the earth::: it’s fine!”

I don’t need to read the whole article to know the answers. You can pay now or you can pay later with illness and the need for healthcare. You are what you eat. As a farmer::: I’ll keep providing high-quality foods that are nutrient dense to my local community that are free of pesticides.

column15:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)*

CAPITALISM SHOULD BE ON SOCIETY'S TERMS

Many in society have been taught to believe that the public has no right to tell corporations what to do with their money any more than a private citizen has the right to tell his neighbor what to do with the money he earns from a business or store. This is not a fair analogy.

True enough that a private citizen doesn’t have the right to tell his neighbor what to do with his money but the public does have the right to tell corporations what to do with their money. Why? Because corporations couldn’t exist without very special and unique government help. Corporations are special legal entities that have unique rights::: privileges::: and protections given by government that ordinary citizens and business owners do not have. And::: since the government in a democracy like ours comes from the people (the majority in society) and it's the people's government that gave corporations their unique rights and privileges::: the people have the right to determine how corporations act and how they spend their money. The majority in a democracy own the franchise of government!

Therefore::: the public has a right to demand something from corporations in exchange for giving corporations the right to exist. Would I not have the right::: even as a private citizen::: to demand something from a business built on my property? The same logic applies to the relationship between the public (society) and corporations. Corporations cannot hide behind the specious argument of rugged individualism!

Many in our society have been brainwashed to believe that an absolutely free marketplace with no government controls or regulations would automatically fix our nation’s problems. Have we forgotten already that the Great Depression of the early 1930s was the direct result of a free market economy with no government control or regulation? The 2008 market crash was because of lack of enough government regulation in capitalism::: and if government hadn't intervened to rescue the banks capitalism would have ended in our country and we would have all starved to death. That's right!

Rugged individualism teaches that the individual has the right to benefit from social and economic interactions with society::: but that society has no right to demand any benefit from the individual.

No one has absolute individual rights in society. Those who want absolute individual rights must live outside of society. Those who want to be part of society with the benefits of government and law must be willing to grant what the majority want::: even if it’s at their own expense.

Yes::: minorities have rights::: but the majority has more rights. Absolute individualism is absolutely unfair. The majority has the right to tax an individual and collect money to build a park even if that individual doesn’t want the park and will never use the park. The majority has a right to tax an individual and use the money to provide welfare or help to those who genuinely can’t help themselves in society.

Self-proclaimed
rugged individualists in society want all the benefits of what the majority has to provide - government::: law::: security::: and protection - but they do not want give up anything to the majority in exchange for these benefits. These so-called rugged individualists are the real leeches and parasites of society.

The fact is there are no real rugged individualists in society!

If capitalism and social consciousness cannot coexist::: then how is it that modern industrialized nations such as Canada::: Sweden::: Norway::: Denmark::: and others can have a high degree of social consciousness and still be capitalistic with a thriving free enterprise?

The rich are not paying their fair share of the taxes. Even billionaire Warren Buffet has said that his office secretary pays more in taxes in proportion to her income than he does.

The wealthy and corporations in our country have socked away trillions of dollars (yes::: trillions of dollars) overseas so that their money cannot be taxed. If our government could tax that money::: at a fair and reasonable rate::: we would have enough money in this country to pay for all public services without having to tax the middle class more. We could do a lot for our nation and people.

Strategic taxes on corporations alone would provide plenty of money to provide a safety net for Americans. These corporations won't go broke but can still thrive and grow. They do it in Sweden::: Denmark::: Norway::: Germany::: Canada. They can do it here in the U.S.A.!

The far right wants no controls and regulations on the economy::: and that's what got us in the economic mess in 2008. Without legitimate controls and regulations in the financial markets::: the greedy in our financial world were able to amass huge fortunes through dishonesty and would have totally destroyed all our lives if not for government intervention into the banking and economic system.

Corporations receive special legal status and tax benefits from the government::: which private business owners do not have::: and the government comes from the people (society). So::: corporations do have a duty to the general society and not just to their shareholders. Government should tax corporations to help society as modern and advanced European nations do (i.e. Sweden::: Norway::: Germany).

People can still become wealthy in a socialist society but not at the detrimental expense of others in society. Many of the basic rights::: especially regarding safety in the work place::: that we take for granted were not graciously given to society by the rich but won by the blood of bludgeoned workers and strikers in the early 20th century.

Read the author's popular Internet articles: THE FAR LEFT AND RIGHT OF THINGS

TRADITIONAL DOCTRINE OF HELL EVOLVED FROM GREEK ROOTS

Visit the author's newest Internet site: THE SCIENCE SUPPORTING CREATION

*The author::: Babu G. Ranganathan::: has his bachelor’s degree with concentrations in theology and biology and has been recognized for his writings on religion and science in the 24th edition of Marquis “Who’s Who in The East.”

column28:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)*

THE CELL could not have evolved. A partially evolved cell would quickly disintegrate under the effects of random forces of the environment::: especially without the protection of a complete and fully functioning cell membrane. A partially evolved cell cannot wait millions of years for chance to make it complete and living! In fact::: it couldn't have even reached the partially evolved state.

CATCH-22 FOR EVOLUTIONARY ORIGIN OF LIFE

Just having the right materials::: elements::: and conditions do not mean that life can arise by chance.

Miller::: in his famous experiment in 1953 showed that individual amino acids (the building blocks of life) could come into existence by chance. But::: it's not enough just to have amino acids. The various amino acids that make-up life must link together in a precise sequence::: just like the letters in a sentence::: to form functioning protein molecules. If they're not in the right sequence the protein molecules won't work. It has never been shown that various amino acids can bind together into a sequence by chance to form protein molecules. Even the simplest cell is made up of many millions of various protein molecules.

What many don't realize is that although oxygen is necessary for life's processes::: the presence of oxygen would prevent life from coming into being. This is because oxygen is destructive unless there are mechanisms already in place to control::: direct::: and regulate it::: such as what we find in already existing forms of life.

RNA and DNA are made up of molecules (nucleic acids) that must also exist in the right sequence. Furthermore::: none of these sequential molecules::: proteins::: DNA::: RNA::: can function outside of a complete and living cell and all are mutually dependent on one another. One cannot come into existence without the other.

Mathematicians have said any event in the universe with odds of 10 to 50th power or greater is impossible! The probability of just a single average size protein molecule arising by chance is 10 to the 65th power. The late great British scientist Sir Frederick Hoyle calculated that the odds of even the simplest cell coming into existence by chance is 10 to the 40:::000th power! How large is this? Consider that the total number of atoms in our universe is 10 to the 82nd power.

The cell could not have evolved. A partially evolved cell would quickly disintegrate under the effects of random forces of the environment::: especially without the protection of a complete and fully functioning cell membrane. A partially evolved cell cannot wait millions of years for chance to make it complete and living! In fact::: it couldn't have even reached the partially evolved state.

Alien beings::: even if they do exist::: could not have evolved. How could they have survived millions of years while the very biological structures::: organs::: and systems necessary for their survival were supposedly still evolving? Life::: in any form (even a single-celled organism)::: must be complete::: fully integrated::: and fully-functioni
ng from the very start to be fit for survival.

Of course::: once there is a complete and living cell then the code and mechanisms exist to direct the formation of more cells. The problem for evolutionists is how did the cell originate when there were no directing code and mechanisms in nature. Natural laws may explain how a cell or airplane works but mere undirected natural laws could not have brought about the existence of either.

What about synthetic life? Scientists didn’t create life itself. What they've done is::: by using intelligent design and sophisticated technology::: scientists built DNA code from scratch and then they implanted that man-made DNA into an already existing living cell and alter that cell. That's what synthetic life is.

Through genetic engineering scientists have been able to produce new forms of life by altering already existing forms of life::: but they have never created life from non-living matter. Even if they do::: it won’t be by chance but by intelligent design. That doesn’t help the theory of evolution.

What about natural selection? Natural selection doesn't create or produce anything. It can only "select" from biological variations that are possible and which have survival value. If a variation occurs that helps a species survive::: that survival is called " natural selection." It's a passive process. There's no conscious selection by nature::: and natural selection only operates in nature once there is life and reproduction and not before::: so it would not be of assistance to the origin of life.

Science can't prove we're here by chance or design. Neither was observed. Both are positions of faith. The issue is which faith is best supported by science. Let the scientific arguments of both sides be presented.

Read my popular Internet articles:

THE NATURAL LIMITS TO EVOLUTION
ANY LIFE ON MARS CAME FROM EARTH

Visit my Internet site: THE SCIENCE SUPPORTING CREATION

Author of the popular Internet article::: TRADITIONAL DOCTRINE OF HELL EVOLVED FROM GREEK ROOTS

*I have given successful lectures (with question and answer period afterwards) defending creation before evolutionist science faculty and students at various colleges and universities. ➡️ Step 3: Enter the password for the account (minimum 8 characters::: with 1 uppercase letter and 1 number)
➡️ Step 4: Enter your first and last name (without accent) in "first name: middle name + first name and" last name: Last name

🆘️ Note: Every 24 hours::: remember to re-enter the App Pi Network::: press the lightning button ⚡️ 1 time::: every day!

column34:
(B.A. Bible/Biology)

WHILE WAITING FOR a proper vaccine::: make sure that you have adequate levels of Vitamins B::: C::: D and the mineral zinc. These nutrients greatly support the immune system and can help prevent an illness from becoming serious and even prevent death from the Covid-19 virus::: as well as other viruses. Do some research::: please.

Even when you get a vaccine::: it’s your immune system that must fight the virus. A proper vaccine jump-starts your immune system in detecting and fighting the virus. A vaccine gives your immune system a head-start to battle the virus.

Interestingly::: they have found that zinc slows down the activity of the virus and this enables your body's immune system to catch-up in fighting the virus.

It takes only pennies a day of supplements to prevent terrible and easily avoidable tragedy.

column8:
Very interesting and pertinent article::: Harvard. Powell is right on the money as it respects today's emerging young people who are coming of age in the midst of one of the worst biological disasters in one hundred and two years. This about it: 2020's seniors were the only ones in the history of high school who never got to do many of the things that are so part and parcel of being a senior::: such as graduation::: the rallies::: the barbecue (at my high school::: anyway::: not sure about others)::: Skip Day::: nor any of the other things that are a part of being a senior. It'll affect them for a long time to come::: and it's not just them. Elementary-aged
kids and middle-aged kids and college-aged kids have been affected::: too. I wonder how my old youth pastor's nine year-old daughter and seven-year-old son will remember it. I really do. Perhaps they might remember it the same way I remember the hurricanes that hit South Florida fifteen years ago when I was their age. We'll see.
column9:
People my age should not get to opine about the pain young people feel TODAY about disruption. When academics start opining about these impacts stretching over multiple decades::: we get a say. Previous generations got through a lot worse than Covid::: e.g.::: WWI::: WW2::: Korean War::: Vietnam War::: oil shocks in 1970s and 80s.

Though those generations retained memories::: some harsh::: they were not permanently stunted::: doomed to a life of penury. These teenagers have a lot of life to live::: more than any previous generation before them. They will work out a new normalcy and thrive as every generation before them has.

column30:
Reading 1 IS 11:1-10

On that day:::
A shoot shall sprout from the stump of Jesse:::
and from his roots a bud shall blossom.
The Spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him:
a Spirit of wisdom and of understanding:::
A Spirit of counsel and of strength:::
a Spirit of knowledge and of fear of the LORD:::
and his delight shall be the fear of the LORD.
Not by appearance shall he judge:::
nor by hearsay shall he decide:::
But he shall judge the poor with justice:::
and decide aright for the land’s afflicted.
He shall strike the ruthless with the rod of his mouth:::
and with the breath of his lips he shall slay the wicked.
Justice shall be the band around his waist:::
and faithfulness a belt upon his hips.
Then the wolf shall be a guest of the lamb:::
and the leopard shall lie down with the kid;
The calf and the young lion shall browse together:::
with a little child to guide them.
The cow and the bear shall be neighbors:::
together their young shall rest;
the lion shall eat hay like the ox.
The baby shall play by the cobra’s den:::
and the child lay his hand on the adder’s lair.
There shall be no harm or ruin on all my holy mountain;
for the earth shall be filled with knowledge of the LORD:::
as water covers the sea.
On that day:::
The root of Jesse:::
set up as a signal for the nations:::
The Gentiles shall seek out:::
for his dwelling shall be glorious.

column4: This school is garbage!
column5:
Harvard University faculty analyzing the elections is to be appreciated. Divisiveness and Diversity Indians can easily understand as India abounds in these two parameters. It is common for minor groups to swing the election result. The analysis has not been done and /or not published from a different angle. That is::: in terms of numbers and percentages of various target/
ethnic groups. According to –not so old statistics –nearly 73% of USA population are whites. So whites constitute the vast majority. However::: of the whites approximately 61% are Non-Hispanic whites. So Hispanic whites are only 12 % . So minimum 27 % are Non-whites and if Hispanic whites are included here then 27 + 12=39%. Even then whites are a majority . But two parties are there . That is where the crucial discussion crops up. So who is swinging the result ? The 27% or 39 % or both or a majority mixture of both ? . Harvard university analysis say that “overwhelming majority of African-Americans::: Latinos and Asians have voted for democrats ..” ( according to one BBC news site many Latinos voted for Republicans) . I do not know how people view this fact reported. Sixty seven percent (67%) of eligible voters have cast their vote equivalent to 160 million people . ( How this 160 million has to be further divided into the above mentioned groups) . One can say that one third of the eligible voters have abstained from voting ! Being an advanced country::: educated and being an important election one would not expect so much of absenteeism from voting. But what is really shocking is people abstaining from voting is common even in USA !! It is really surprising that 67% this time is the highest turn out during the last hundred years !! So a pertinent question is::: who among the above mentioned target groups usually refrain from voting ? Who during the past and who this time ? The same target groups ?? Very likely the absenteeism from voting- both in the past and this time-\-\ is more among whites than in Non-whites. For future also one can make calculations. Presuming that even all whites are equally divided between the two parties –36.5 % each the remaining target groups -27%- can always influence the outcome. So to counteract the 27 % Non-whites::: proportionally whites have to vote if they want to decide which party to win ! As long as white’s votes are equally divided or even more or less equally divided between the two parties ::: it is the 27 % Non-whites who will be deciding the election result.

column29:
The math is simple::: each plant has a huge string of DNA which they draw various enzymes and process to make molecules. Different plant families have a widely different array of them. The inner workings of a plant are the exact same chemistry that occurs inside people::: while the bio-molecule has some purpose in the plant::: there a chance it interacts with the human body in some way and in some form. By chance some will be beneficial and by chance some will be harmful::: or any shade in between. In all the randomness::: that one bean fava bean::: turned out to inhibit the Parkinson's prion. Which lead to the medication levidopa. Large percentage of US medications where first discovered in plant extracts. Which is why in the 80 and 90s it was popular for explorers to find plants in the Amazon to draw from millions of different unique chemicals::: some of which could improve outcomes for some horrible cancers. Now that Researchers are improving their understanding of gut flora::: not only is this vast diversity have unique effects on the body::: some could end up interacting with the gut ecology to produce beneficial or harmful effects. In case of Parkinson's the Prion that causes it comes from the gut::: travels up the Vagus nerve. It took researchers a long time to figure that out::: by first reports of vagus nerve being cut vastly lowered Parkinson's. So they followed the nerve down and found low fiber diets cause a gut bacteria that normally beneficial to get the fiber from the intestine lining. But they don't know what specie is creating the prion. They know its a gut microbe because in mice studies gut sterile mice wouldn't get Parkinson. They would only get Parkinson disease if a gut culture from mice that would get Parkinson was put in the mice. Gut Ecology is a huge number of species. It could be some random substance just knocks out that harmful specie. But that research raises huge question about colon health::: because if gut microbes are getting fibers from the intestine in low fiber diets::: what other problems is it causing.

https://
www.webmd.com/
colorectal-cance
r/news/
20111110/
high-fiber-diet-
linked-to-lower
-colon-cancer-r
isk#1

Being interested in ecology::: and the finding of traces of BLV virus dna inside breast cancer tissue. BLV is a virus that spreads from cow to cow and never infects humans. However::: what happens if a virus designed for an animal gets into a human cell? It could release DNA damaging enzymes::: and could insert its code::: just that its code isn't designed to cause replication. So no infection occurs but it leaves a single cell behind with damaged and altered DNA. So the intestine lining is likely hugely benefitial thing::: if nothing else to keep viruses out. Viruses that may only be designed for flies::: or the plant.. but some of those viruses could have tools it made to edit DNA. I just don't think this knowledge has had time to make its way to Harvard::: because a lot of it is really really new. However once all the science facts and the statistics start getting put together::: there could be some really brilliant studies that come out that cause a paradigm shift.

column13:
Emotionally people would want a perfect system::: however in terms of logic one may not exist. Step 1::: count the variations in admission techniques. There is infinite number of them. The perspective of google's method of ai::: is to take a measurement of a point in the space of admission structures::: and look for an optimal point. However::: its not just one measurement::: its a system of measurements. In addition Harvard can't explore the space of choices as easily as a computer simulation for fitness value. The sheer size and variations possible and the difficulty and complexity of searching for optimal choices::: its incredible likely the optimal choice remains illusive. Its also likely Harvard admission is stuck in a steepest decent value. The correct way would be to allow school vouchers to add variation and diversity of choices in education::: and with a system of universities that explore the choice space::: places like Harvard could draw from those to improve. So in court it could be demonstrated there is no perfect admission standards::: and that Harvard by itself can not make the leaps to get into more optimal choices.

The statistics of singling out Harvard::: maybe its just Harvard is doing the right thing and just fell one way on standard deviations. So the above argument gets into the core of the data collected::: and is it correct to take a measurement of Harvard and say the system is broken? No::: one has to look at many sample spaces to get a feel if current admission cenetics::: the conceptual genetic structure::: is working or not. The correct way would be to measure over several academic admissions and find common concepts like average and standard deviations. Court shouldn't single out a university like Harvard if they are not significantly below a standard deviation for performance. It could also be that Harvard is doing the right thing::: but that the investments in change of structure takes time to mature. That means yearly trend data also matters. Harvard being a private university the statistics could be representing there are family traditions of going to Harvard. Once all the data is properly accounted for::: it could be that Harvard has no problems at all::: and its just some people getting all worked up over statistical illusions. You work on the core to improve statistics::: instead of the undereducated approach of trying to do things to force improvement in statistics.

“Einstein and all the scientists did not understand the mass–energy equivalence equation E = mc^2::: because it is Not an ‘equivalence’::: it is a fact::: because in Ferent Quantum Gravity mass is made of light::: Gamma rays”
Adrian Ferent

“In 2018 Adrian Ferent discovered mass–energy equivalence for Dark Matter E = md × vp^2::: added it to E = mc^2 and Ferent’s mass–energy equivalence equation: E= mc^2 + md × vp^2”
Adrian Ferent

“In electron and positron collision Gamma rays are created because electrons and positrons are made of Gamma rays”
Adrian Ferent

“Because in Ferent Quantum Gravity the electrons are made of Gamma rays and Dark Matter::: is the first proofs for the mass–energy equivalence equation: E = mc^2 “
Adrian Ferent

“Because in Ferent Quantum Gravity the electrons are made of Gamma rays and Dark Matter::: is the first proofs for Ferent’s mass–energy equivalence equation: E= mc^2 + md × vp^2 “
Adrian Ferent

Mass-energy equivalence
E = mc^2 states that the equivalent energy E is the mass multiplied by the square of the speed of light.
This is the most famous equation in the world::: the one defining the relation between mass and energy.

In 1704 Newton wrote in his book “Opticks”:
"Gross bodies and light are convertible into one another..."
With this words Newton created the mass-energy equivalence principle::: which urged later scientists to find mathematical solutions for his logical hypothesis.

In 1873 Nikolay Umov created an equation for mass energy transformation:
E=kmc^2 where 0:::5 ≤ k ≤ 1

In 1900 H. Poincare and in 1903 Olinto de Pretto concluded too::: that the relation between energy and mass is E = mc^2.

In 1905 Albert Einstein did not formulate exactly the equation E=mc2 but he said: ’if a body gives off the energy L in the form of radiation::: its mass diminishes by L/c2’. Thus means for Einstein the inertial mass of an object changes if the object absorbs or emits energy.

“In 2018 Adrian Ferent discovered mass–energy equivalence for Dark Matter E = md × vp^2::: added it to E = mc^2 and Ferent’s mass–energy equivalence equation: E= mc^2 + md × vp^2”
Adrian Ferent

Adrian Ferent discovered that:

“In Ferent Quantum Gravity the electrons::: the positrons::: Matter and Antimatter are made of Gamma rays and Dark Matter”
Adrian Ferent

“Because in Ferent Quantum Gravity the electrons are made of Gamma rays and Dark Matter::: is the first proofs for the mass–energy equivalence equation: E = mc^2 “
Adrian Ferent

“Because in Ferent Quantum Gravity the electrons are made of Gamma rays and Dark Matter::: is the first proofs for Ferent’s mass–energy equivalence equation: E= mc^2 + md × vp^2 “
Adrian Ferent

“In electron and positron collision Gamma rays are created because electrons and positrons are made of Gamma rays”
Adrian Ferent

Einstein said; “You know::: it would be sufficient to understand the electron” which is still true today.

“Conclusion: No Conclusion. So::: what is an electron? An electron is a particle::: and a wave; it is ideally simple::: and unimaginably complex; it is precisely understood::: and utterly mysterious; it is rigid::: and subject to creative disassembly. No single answer does justice to reality. ” – Frank Wilczek

“The electron is not an elementary particle::: because it is composed of a Photon and a Dark Matter electron”
Adrian Ferent

That is why the Standard model is wrong.

“The high energy Gravitons emitted by Dark Matter keep the photon inside the electron”
Adrian Ferent

“The electron energy is the sum of the photon energy and the Dark Matter electron energy”
Adrian Ferent

“The particle energy E::: is the sum of Matter energy and Dark Matter energy:
E = Em + Edm”
Adrian Ferent
